form.rateDescription: Enter a value between 0 and 999,999.9999 with up to 4 decimal places
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe this utility type and how it should be calculated...

validation.utilityNameMinLength: Utility name must be at least 2 characters
validation.utilityNameInvalidChars: Utility name can only contain letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens, and dots
validation.utilityNameMaxWords: Utility name should be maximum 5 words
validation.utilityNameConsecutiveSpaces: Utility name should not have consecutive spaces
validation.utilityNameTrimSpaces: Utility name should not start or end with spaces
validation.ratePerUnitInvalid: Rate must be a valid number
validation.ratePerUnitMaxDecimals: Rate can have maximum 4 decimal places

calculationMethods.allocated: Allocated based on usage or area

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this utility type? This action cannot be undone.
confirm.toggleActive: Are you sure you want to {{action}} this utility type?

errors.validationErrors: Please fix the validation errors above

guide.fixedDescription: Use for utilities with consistent monthly charges like internet, cable TV, or basic service fees that don't vary with usage.
guide.meteredDescription: Use for consumption-based utilities like electricity, water, or gas that are measured by meters and vary monthly.
guide.allocatedDescription: Use for shared expenses like Common Area Maintenance (CAM), trash collection, or security that are divided among tenants.
guide.rateDescription: Set the base rate that will be used in billing fee calculations. This serves as the default rate for this utility type.

expenseHistory.title: {role} Mall Owner Expenses

howItWorks.title: How It Works - Correct Calculation
howItWorks.keyPrincipleText: Mall owner pays for ALL areas that are NOT occupied by tenants. This includes both vacant units AND any unallocated space in the building.

steps.determineOccupiedText: Sum of all units with active tenants.
steps.calculateOwnerShareText: Total CAM - Tenants' portion for occupied area.

howItWorks.note: Note: All expense records are now stored in the database. {roleInfo} The system prevents duplicate entries for the same building and period.
howItWorks.nonAdminNote: You can only view expenses for your assigned building.
howItWorks.adminNote: As an administrator, you can view all expenses.

noData.title: No Performance Data Available
noData.description: Performance metrics require paid invoices with utility items and contract data. Once you have paid invoices for rent and utilities, these metrics will be automatically calculated.

requirements.rentInvoices: Create and mark invoices with RENT items as PAID
requirements.utilityInvoices: Add utility invoices (ELECTRICITY, WATER) and mark as PAID
requirements.contracts: Ensure contracts are associated with units and buildings
requirements.dates: Use issue dates in current or previous year

utilityTrend.title: Utility Cost Trend
utilityTrend.description: Annual utility costs in lakhs MMK

table.title: Building Utility Cost Analysis
table.subtitle: Detailed cost comparison and performance analysis by property
table.noDataDescription: Add invoices with utility items to see performance metrics

dataInterpretation.title: Data Interpretation
dataInterpretation.description: Data shows utility cost changes year-over-year. Negative percentages indicate cost reductions (good), positive percentages indicate cost increases (requires attention).

currencyInformation.title: Currency Information
currencyInformation.description: All monetary values are displayed in Myanmar Kyat (MMK). The values are shown in lakhs (1 Lakh = 100,000 MMK).
currencyInformation.noteDescription: All currency values are automatically converted to lakhs format. 1 Lakh = 100,000 Myanmar Kyats.
